question: As per the Treaty of Allahbad (1765), the British East India Company got the diwani rights of which of the following places?
explanation: As per the Treaty of Allahabad (August 16, 1765), the Mughal Emperor Shah Alam II granted Diwani (right to collect revenue) of Bengal, Bihar and Orissa to the British East India Company. The treaty was signed between Lord Clive and Mughal Emperor Shah Alam II and Nawab Shuja-ud-Daulah of Awadh.
